thread.title: P&O and Cunard join conservation scheme
thread.title_full: P&O and Cunard join conservation scheme

title: P&O and Cunard join conservation scheme
text:
P&O and Cunard join conservation scheme 21 July 2015 Save 
P&O Cruises and Cunard crews are taking part in a new country-wide whale, dolphin and porpoise conservation scheme. 
Both have received training in how to spot cetaceans for reports that will then be compiled by conservation charity ORCA that is holding an OceanWatch from July 25 to August 2. 
It is hoped the scheme, which is also being joined by the Royal Navy, Wightlink and commercial shipping companies, will help the charity better understand both the mammals’ numbers and their habitats 
Sally Hamilton, UK director of ORCA said, “OceanWatch Week will be the offshore component to the National Whale and Dolphin Watch Week which is run every year by the Sea Watch Foundation. 
“We’ve enlisted the help of local seafaring businesses that use Portsmouth International Port and ports along the south of England. I 
“t’s a fantastic way for the public and local businesses and organisations who use the sea to get actively involved in marine conservation.”
